title: feDistantLight
shortDescriptionOfTheTag: The feDistantLight SVG filter primitive defines a distant light source that can be used within a lighting filter primitive to achieve a lighting effect. The lighting effect created by this light source results in a spotlight, with the light becoming weaker as the angle of incidence moves away from the spot direction.

usageExamples.title: Example 1
usageExamples.description: Applying a feDistantLight filter to an SVG shape.
usageExamples.code: <svg width='100' height='100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><filter id='distant_light'><feDistantLight azimuth='45' elevation='30'/></filter><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' fill='green' filter='url(#distant_light)'/></svg>

usageExamples.title: Example 2
usageExamples.description: Using feDistantLight with other filter primitives.
usageExamples.code: <svg width='100' height='100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><filter id='combined_filters'><feDistantLight azimuth='135' elevation='45'/><feSpecularLighting in='SourceGraphic' surfaceScale='5'result='specOut' specularConstant='0.42' specularExponent='1.5'><fePointLight x='200' y='100' z='50'/></feSpecularLighting></filter><rect width='100' height='100' filter='url(#combined_filters)'/></svg>
